greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of arrangements of n circles in the affine plane having k outer circles.
comment: Consider the arrangements of n circles described in A250001.
T(n,k) is the number of arrangements of n circles in the affine plane whose perimeters are formed with parts from k circles. - _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 09 2015
Observation 1: column 1 gives A250001, at least if 1<=n<=4.
Observation 2: sum of n-th row = T(n+1,1), at least if 1<=n<=3. (End)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 14 2014
ext: Corrected a(5)-a(6) and added a(7)-a(10) from _Omar E. Pol_, Oct 13 2015
